donor_name: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT
outputs.output_descr: Sri Lanka's forests can make a significant contribution in both adaptation and mitigation. The Government, Ministry of Environment (MoE) and key stakeholder groups seeks to maximize this contribution by developing a national strategy for Reducing Emissions from Deforestation and Forest Degradation (REDD) and add value to REDD by including conservation, sustainable management of forests and enhancement of forest carbon stocks. The value added REDD effort is identified as REDD+. As a pre-requisite for REDD+ a number of institutional structures and policies need to be established. As such the UN-REDD Programme in Sri Lanka will support Forest Department of the Ministry of Environment to prepare the required enabling environment for REDD+.
